Properties.ProtectedString:
--Made by Luckymaxer
Tool = script.Parent Handle = Tool:WaitForChild("Handle")
Players = game:GetService("Players") Debris = game:GetService("Debris") RunService = game:GetService("RunService")
BaseUrl = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id="
local function Create_PrivImpl(objectType) if type(objectType) ~= 'string' then error("Argument of Create must be a string", 2) end --return the proxy function that gives us the nice Create'string'{data} syntax --The first function call is a function call using Lua's single-string-argument syntax --The second function call is using Lua's single-table-argument syntax --Both can be chained together for the nice effect. return function(dat) --default to nothing, to handle the no argument given case dat = dat or {}
--make the object to mutate local obj = Instance.new(objectType) local parent = nil
--stored constructor function to be called after other initialization local ctor = nil
for k, v in pairs(dat) do --add property if type(k) == 'string' then if k == 'Parent' then -- Parent should always be set last, setting the Parent of a new object -- immediately makes performance worse for all subsequent property updates. parent = v else obj[k] = v end
--add child elseif type(k) == 'number' then if type(v) ~= 'userdata' then error("Bad entry in Create body: Numeric keys must be paired with children, got a: "..type(v), 2) end v.Parent = obj
--event connect elseif type(k) == 'table' and k.__eventname then if type(v) ~= 'function' then error("Bad entry in Create body: Key `[Create.E\'"..k.__eventname.."\']` must have a function value\ got: "..tostring(v), 2) end obj[k.__eventname]:connect(v)
--define constructor function elseif k == t.Create then if type(v) ~= 'function' then error("Bad entry in Create body: Key `[Create]` should be paired with a constructor function, \ got: "..tostring(v), 2) elseif ctor then --ctor already exists, only one allowed error("Bad entry in Create body: Only one constructor function is allowed", 2) end ctor = v
else error("Bad entry ("..tostring(k).." => "..tostring(v)..") in Create body", 2) end end
--apply constructor function if it exists if ctor then ctor(obj) end
if parent then obj.Parent = parent end
--return the completed object return obj end end
--now, create the functor: Create = setmetatable({}, {__call = function(tb, ...) return Create_PrivImpl(...) end})
--and create the "Event.E" syntax stub. Really it's just a stub to construct a table which our Create --function can recognize as special. Create.E = function(eventName) return {__eventname = eventName} end
BasePart = Create("Part"){ Shape = Enum.PartType.Block, Material = Enum.Material.Plastic, FormFactor = Enum.FormFactor.Custom, TopSurface = Enum.SurfaceType.Smooth, BottomSurface = Enum.SurfaceType.Smooth, Size = Vector3.new(0.2, 0.2, 0.2), Locked = true, CanCollide = true, Anchored = false, }
ReloadTime = 0
ToolEquipped = false
Handle.Transparency = 0 Tool.Enabled = true
function SetFlame() if FireDisplay then FireDisplay:disconnect() end for i, v in pairs(Tool:GetChildren()) do if v:IsA("BasePart") and v ~= Handle then v:Destroy() end end FlamePart = BasePart:Clone() FlamePart.Name = "Flame" FlamePart.Transparency = 1 FlamePart.CanCollide = false Light = Create("PointLight"){ Name = "Light", Color = Color3.new((255 / 255), (255 / 255), (0 / 255)), Brightness = 50, Range = 5, Shadows = false, Enabled = false, Parent = FlamePart, } local Weld = Create("Weld"){ Part0 = Handle, Part1 = FlamePart, C0 = CFrame.new(0, 2.5, 0), C1 = CFrame.new(0, 0, 0), Parent = FlamePart, } FlamePart.Parent = Tool end
function Activated() if not Tool.Enabled then return end Tool.Enabled = false if Light then Light.Enabled = not Light.Enabled if FireDisplay then FireDisplay:disconnect() end if Light.Enabled then Spawn(function() local FlamePieces = {} local LastFire = tick() FireDisplay = RunService.Stepped:connect(function(Time, Step) local Now = tick() if not Light.Enabled or (Now - LastFire) >= 0.2 then return end LastFire = Now local Colors = {"Bright orange", "Bright yellow", "Bright red"} local Size = (math.random(10, 80) * 0.01) local Flame = BasePart:Clone() Flame.Name = "Effect" Flame.Transparency = (math.random(15, 50) * 0.01) Flame.BrickColor = BrickColor.new(Colors[math.random(1, #Colors)]) Flame.Material = Enum.Material.Plastic Flame.TopSurface = Enum.SurfaceType.SmoothNoOutlines Flame.BottomSurface = Enum.SurfaceType.SmoothNoOutlines Flame.LeftSurface = Enum.SurfaceType.SmoothNoOutlines Flame.RightSurface = Enum.SurfaceType.SmoothNoOutlines Flame.FrontSurface = Enum.SurfaceType.SmoothNoOutlines Flame.BackSurface = Enum.SurfaceType.SmoothNoOutlines Flame.Size = Vector3.new(Size, Size, Size) Flame.CanCollide = false local FlameWeld = Create("Weld"){ Part0 = FlamePart, Part1 = Flame, C0 = (CFrame.new(0, 0, 0) + (CFrame.new(0, 0, 0) * CFrame.Angles(math.random(-360, 360), math.random(-360, 360), math.random(-360, 360))).lookVector * (math.random(1, 300) * 0.001)), C1 = (CFrame.new(0, 0, 0) * CFrame.Angles(math.random(), math.random(), math.random())), Parent = Flame, } table.insert(FlamePieces, Flame) Debris:AddItem(Flame, (math.random() * 1.5)) for i, v in pairs(FlamePieces) do v.Transparency = (v.Transparency + 0.05) if v.Transparency >= 1 then table.remove(FlamePieces, i) if v and v.Parent then v:Destroy() end end end Flame.Parent = Tool end) end) else for i, v in pairs(Tool:GetChildren()) do if v:IsA("BasePart") and v ~= Handle and v ~= FlamePart then v:Destroy() end end end end wait(ReloadTime) Tool.Enabled = true end
function CheckIfAlive() return (((Player and Player.Parent and Character and Character.Parent and Humanoid and Humanoid.Parent and Humanoid.Health > 0 and Head and Head.Parent) and true) or false) end
function Equipped() Character = Tool.Parent Player = Players:GetPlayerFromCharacter(Character) Humanoid = Character:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") Head = Character:FindFirstChild("Head") if not CheckIfAlive() then return end ToolEquipped = true end
function Unequipped() ToolEquipped = false end
Delay(0, (function() SetFlame() end))
Tool.Activated:connect(Activated) Tool.Equipped:connect(Equipped) Tool.Unequipped:connect(Unequipped)
